title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
text: nearjsonrpc provides small, focused wrappers around NEAR Protocol JSON-RPC API. goal make easy query account state, blocks, network status, transactions call view functions reproducible R scripts.

title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
text: Set endpoint:
code: near_set_endpoint('mainnet') ## ✔ NEAR RPC endpoint set to <https://rpc.mainnet.near.org>

title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
code: near_query_account("vitalik.near") ## # A tibble: 1 × 8 ##   account_id   amount     locked storage_usage code_hash block_height block_hash ##   <chr>        <chr>      <chr>          <int> <chr>            <int> <chr>      ## 1 vitalik.near 546329351… 0             358058 55E7imni…    176268046 AfS7LTk6i… ## # ℹ 1 more variable: raw_response <list>

what: List all access keys associated with a NEAR account
title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
code: keys = near_get_access_keys("vitalik.near") keys ## # A tibble: 7 × 5 ##   public_key                   access_key   block_height block_hash raw_response ##   <chr>                        <list>              <int> <chr>      <list>       ## 1 ed25519:5a4CCWCJrnMGxSVtjMp… <named list>    176268047 7qVSLJovA… <named list> ## 2 ed25519:6EBwyCYEjH1VsjJSUQo… <named list>    176268047 7qVSLJovA… <named list> ## 3 ed25519:77oj7oJGG3AoeRaKaAF… <named list>    176268047 7qVSLJovA… <named list> ## 4 ed25519:7CH3JEY5abPhVcdPQxg… <named list>    176268047 7qVSLJovA… <named list> ## 5 ed25519:9ePBRZ3W1RpUKsaErip… <named list>    176268047 7qVSLJovA… <named list> ## 6 ed25519:Dr9NjCcEMvXEjECaJ9t… <named list>    176268047 7qVSLJovA… <named list> ## 7 ed25519:DyijRtwLRrSysLAgEAn… <named list>    176268047 7qVSLJovA… <named list> library(dplyr) ##  ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ##  ##     filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ##  ##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(purrr) ##  ## Attaching package: 'purrr' ## The following object is masked from 'package:nearjsonrpc': ##  ##     %||% library(tidyr) library(rlang) ##  ## Attaching package: 'rlang' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:purrr': ##  ##     %@%, flatten, flatten_chr, flatten_dbl, flatten_int, flatten_lgl, ##     flatten_raw, invoke, splice ## The following object is masked from 'package:nearjsonrpc': ##  ##     %||% keys = near_get_access_keys("vitalik.near") library(dplyr) library(purrr) library(tidyr) library(rlang)  # Flatten raw_response into a dataframe all_keys_df <- map_dfr(keys$raw_response, function(resp) {   # Some elements may not have $keys   if (!is.null(resp$keys)) {     map_dfr(resp$keys, function(k) {       ak <- k$access_key       pk <- k$public_key %||% NA_character_              if (is.list(ak) && "FunctionCall" %in% names(ak$permission)) {         fc <- ak$permission$FunctionCall         tibble(           block_hash   = resp$block_hash %||% NA_character_,           block_height = resp$block_height %||% NA_integer_,           public_key   = pk,           nonce        = ak$nonce,           allowance    = fc$allowance %||% NA_character_,           method_names = if (length(fc$method_names) > 0) paste(fc$method_names, collapse = ", ") else NA_character_,           receiver_id  = fc$receiver_id,           permission_type = "FunctionCall"         )       } else {         tibble(           block_hash   = resp$block_hash %||% NA_character_,           block_height = resp$block_height %||% NA_integer_,           public_key   = pk,           nonce        = ak$nonce,           allowance    = NA_character_,           method_names = NA_character_,           receiver_id  = NA_character_,           permission_type = "FullAccess"         )       }     })   } else {     tibble(       block_hash   = NA_character_,       block_height = NA_integer_,       public_key   = NA_character_,       nonce        = NA_integer_,       allowance    = NA_character_,       method_names = NA_character_,       receiver_id  = NA_character_,       permission_type = NA_character_     )   } })  all_keys_df ## # A tibble: 49 × 8 ##    block_hash block_height public_key   nonce allowance method_names receiver_id ##    <chr>             <int> <chr>        <dbl> <chr>     <chr>        <chr>       ##  1 AfkjwGPn9…    176268048 ed25519:5… 1.4 e 1 23318196… add_request… vitalik.ne… ##  2 AfkjwGPn9…    176268048 ed25519:6… 1.5 e 1 NA        add_request… vitalik.ne… ##  3 AfkjwGPn9…    176268048 ed25519:7… 0       25000000… NA           claim-toke… ##  4 AfkjwGPn9…    176268048 ed25519:7… 5.24e13 25000000… NA           launchpad.… ##  5 AfkjwGPn9…    176268048 ed25519:9… 3.1 e 1 NA        confirm      vitalik.ne… ##  6 AfkjwGPn9…    176268048 ed25519:D… 5.24e13 24755542… add_request… vitalik.ne… ##  7 AfkjwGPn9…    176268048 ed25519:D… 3   e 0 NA        NA           NA          ##  8 AfkjwGPn9…    176268048 ed25519:5… 1.4 e 1 23318196… add_request… vitalik.ne… ##  9 AfkjwGPn9…    176268048 ed25519:6… 1.5 e 1 NA        add_request… vitalik.ne… ## 10 AfkjwGPn9…    176268048 ed25519:7… 0       25000000… NA           claim-toke… ## # ℹ 39 more rows ## # ℹ 1 more variable: permission_type <chr>

what: Get Current Network Status and Node Info
title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
code: status = near_network_status() status ## # A tibble: 1 × 8 ##   chain_id latest_block_height latest_block_hash                 syncing version ##   <chr>                  <int> <chr>                             <lgl>   <chr>   ## 1 mainnet            176268052 DjiY1igXCaXhvgRvAGLqq2CrZWaRUCQU… FALSE   2.10.1  ## # ℹ 3 more variables: protocol_version <int>, validators <list>, ## #   raw_response <list>

title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
code: protocol_config = near_get_protocol_config() protocol_config ## # A tibble: 1 × 5 ##   block_height block_hash config            runtime_config   raw_response      ##          <int> <chr>      <list>            <list>           <list>            ## 1           NA NA         <named list [33]> <named list [6]> <named list [33]>

title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
text: FT Metadata Total supply Balance query
code: near_call_view_function("wrap.near", "ft_metadata") ## # A tibble: 1 × 9 ##   account_id method_name result_raw result_text result_json  logs   block_height ##   <chr>      <chr>       <list>     <chr>       <list>       <list>        <int> ## 1 wrap.near  ft_metadata <raw>      "{\"spec\"… <named list> <list>    176268052 ## # ℹ 2 more variables: block_hash <chr>, raw_response <list> near_call_view_function("wrap.near", "ft_total_supply") ## # A tibble: 1 × 9 ##   account_id method_name  result_raw result_text result_json logs   block_height ##   <chr>      <chr>        <list>     <chr>       <list>      <list>        <int> ## 1 wrap.near  ft_total_su… <raw [34]> "\"1823371… <chr [1]>   <list>    176268053 ## # ℹ 2 more variables: block_hash <chr>, raw_response <list> near_call_view_function("wrap.near", "ft_balance_of",                         args = list(account_id = "vitalik.near")) ## # A tibble: 1 × 9 ##   account_id method_name  result_raw result_text result_json logs   block_height ##   <chr>      <chr>        <list>     <chr>       <list>      <list>        <int> ## 1 wrap.near  ft_balance_… <raw [3]>  "\"0\""     <chr [1]>   <list>    176268054 ## # ℹ 2 more variables: block_hash <chr>, raw_response <list>

title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
code: library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(scales) ##  ## Attaching package: 'scales' ## The following object is masked from 'package:purrr': ##  ##     discard # Get recent validator stakes vals <- near_get_validators()  vals %>%   slice_head(n = 10) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = reorder(account_id, stake_near), y = stake_near)) +   geom_col(fill = "steelblue") +   coord_flip() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   # makes stake readable with commas   labs(     title = "Top 10 Validators by Stake",     x = "Validator",     y = "Stake (NEAR)"   ) +   theme_minimal()

what: Distribution of States (Major of the validators few Stakes)
title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
code: vals %>%   ggplot(aes(x = stake_near)) +   geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill = "darkgreen", color = "white") +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Distribution of Validator Stakes",     x = "Stake (NEAR)",     y = "Number of Validators"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
code: vals %>%   slice_max(order_by = stake_near, n = 10) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = "", y = stake_near, fill = account_id)) +   geom_col(width = 1) +   coord_polar(theta = "y") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Top 10 Validators Stake Share",     fill = "Validator"   ) +   theme_void()

title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
text: Show concentrated stake among validators
code: vals %>%   arrange(desc(stake_near)) %>%   mutate(cum_stake = cumsum(stake_near) / sum(stake_near),          cum_validators = row_number() / n()) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = cum_validators, y = cum_stake)) +   geom_line(color = "gold", size = 1.2) +   geom_abline(slope = 1, intercept = 0, linetype = "dashed") +   labs(     title = "Lorenz Curve of Validator Stakes",     x = "Cumulative Share of Validators",     y = "Cumulative Share of Stake"   ) +   theme_minimal() ## Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. ## ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. ## This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. ## Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was ## generated.

title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
text: result indicates validator stakes highly concentrated. small number validators control majority total stake. network therefore less decentralized terms stake distribution.
code: vals %>%   arrange(desc(stake_near)) %>%   mutate(cum_share = cumsum(stake_near) / sum(stake_near)) %>%   slice_head(n = 20) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = reorder(account_id, cum_share), y = cum_share)) +   geom_col(fill = "orange") +   coord_flip() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent) +   labs(     title = "Cumulative Stake Share of Top 20 Validators",     x = "Validator",     y = "Cumulative Stake Share"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: nearjsonrpc: Introduction
text: Latest block Block height Block hash
code: near_get_block("final") ## # A tibble: 1 × 10 ##      height hash  prev_hash timestamp           author chunks_included gas_price ##       <int> <chr> <chr>     <dttm>              <chr>            <int> <chr>     ## 1 176268067 AaBq… Fb5G3Ewk… 2025-12-10 18:13:43 epoch…               9 100000000 ## # ℹ 3 more variables: total_supply <chr>, latest_protocol_version <int>, ## #   raw_response <list> near_get_block(176259877) ## # A tibble: 1 × 10 ##      height hash  prev_hash timestamp           author chunks_included gas_price ##       <int> <chr> <chr>     <dttm>              <chr>            <int> <chr>     ## 1 176259877 CanD… BREsXR6t… 2025-12-10 16:47:44 epic.…               9 100000000 ## # ℹ 3 more variables: total_supply <chr>, latest_protocol_version <int>, ## #   raw_response <list> near_get_block("CanDKa6nYDQ89iv5U7sE1YDFteBRkBG6qBJjiM5YwGtY") ## # A tibble: 1 × 10 ##      height hash  prev_hash timestamp           author chunks_included gas_price ##       <int> <chr> <chr>     <dttm>              <chr>            <int> <chr>     ## 1 176259877 CanD… BREsXR6t… 2025-12-10 16:47:44 epic.…               9 100000000 ## # ℹ 3 more variables: total_supply <chr>, latest_protocol_version <int>, ## #   raw_response <list>

what: A Lightweight NEAR Protocol JSON-RPC Client
title: A Lightweight NEAR Protocol JSON-RPC Client
text: R client NEAR Protocol JSON-RPC API nearjsonrpc brings full power NEAR Protocol JSON-RPC API directly R, designed R developer, R developers, data scientists, blockchain analysts. nearjsonrpc provides clean, type-safe, well-documented functions return tidy data frames (tibbles) default, making seamless integrate NEAR blockchain data openssl, cyphr, sodium, digest, jsonlite, httr2, dplyr, tidyr, purrr shiny R packages.

title: A Lightweight NEAR Protocol JSON-RPC Client
text: Full coverage essential NEAR JSON-RPC methods Automatic JSON parsing tidy tibbles Support mainnet, testnet, custom RPC endpoints Built-retry logic clear error messages Comprehensive documentation + vignettes 100% open-source

title: A Lightweight NEAR Protocol JSON-RPC Client
text: functions coming soon!

title: A Lightweight NEAR Protocol JSON-RPC Client
code: # Install from CRAN (when available) install.packages("nearjsonrpc")  # Or the development version from GitHub # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("sawsimeon/nearjsonrpc")

title: A Lightweight NEAR Protocol JSON-RPC Client
code: library(nearjsonrpc) library(tidyr) library(purrr)  # Use mainnet (or "testnet", "betanet") near_set_endpoint("mainnet") ✔ NEAR RPC endpoint set to https://rpc.mainnet.near.org  # Get account balance and details near_query_account("vitalik.near") # # A tibble: 1 × 8 #   account_id   amount            locked storage_usage code_hash   block_height block_hash  raw_response #   <chr>        <chr>             <chr>          <int> <chr>              <int> <chr>       <list>       # 1 vitalik.near 5463293519585…    0           358058 55E7imni…      175996396 ECbLMFUSC… <named list>  # List all access keys near_get_access_keys("vitalik.near") # # A tibble: 7 × 5 #   public_key                                       access_key   block_height block_hash raw_response #   <chr>                                            <list>              <int> <chr>      <list>       # 1 ed25519:5a4CCWCJrnMGxSVtjMpxx3qUZ57qH9Tn1Ed8tKY… <named list>    175997459 9JDmQw9m3… <named list> # 2 ed25519:6EBwyCYEjH1VsjJSUQo6jfH9yvowJ73bdzy9tAG… <named list>    175997459 9JDmQw9m3… <named list> # 3 ed25519:77oj7oJGG3AoeRaKaAFoPdtZhxeDN3nDwAP3yC8… <named list>    175997459 9JDmQw9m3… <named list> # 4 ed25519:7CH3JEY5abPhVcdPQxg8FmNnnHVF6E82tMzgFvo… <named list>    175997459 9JDmQw9m3… <named list> # 5 ed25519:9ePBRZ3W1RpUKsaEripj55jiiREaoJG2Jn3UTBo… <named list>    175997459 9JDmQw9m3… <named list> # 6 ed25519:Dr9NjCcEMvXEjECaJ9thavk8FQTnhLCgvC4vaft… <named list>    175997459 9JDmQw9m3… <named list> # 7 ed25519:DyijRtwLRrSysLAgEAn5fdAfMdfYmSZez5HCLfh… <named list>    175997459 9JDmQw9m3… <named list>  # title: Null-coalescing operator — %||%
text: Null-coalescing operator

title: Null-coalescing operator — %||%
Null-coalescing operator — %||%
text: x, y Objects

title: Null-coalescing operator — %||%
text: x NULL, otherwise y

what: Broadcast a Signed Transaction to the NEAR Network — near_broadcast_tx
title: Broadcast a Signed Transaction to the NEAR Network — near_broadcast_tx
text: Sends pre-signed transaction (base64 format) NEAR blockchain using modern send_tx JSON-RPC method (replaces deprecated broadcast_tx_async/commit).

title: Broadcast a Signed Transaction to the NEAR Network — near_broadcast_tx
code: near_broadcast_tx(   signed_tx_base64,   wait_until = c("EXECUTED_OPTIMISTIC", "NONE", "INCLUDED", "INCLUDED_FINAL", "FINAL") )

title: Broadcast a Signed Transaction to the NEAR Network — near_broadcast_tx
text: signed_tx_base64 Character scalar. fully signed transaction encoded base64. Typically created using nearapi near-cli near transaction sign .... wait_until Character scalar controlling long node waits returning. Valid options: "NONE" – returns immediately transaction hash "INCLUDED" – waits included block "INCLUDED_FINAL" – waits included finalized block "EXECUTED_OPTIMISTIC" – waits execution (default, recommended) "FINAL" – waits finality (strongest guarantee)

title: Broadcast a Signed Transaction to the NEAR Network — near_broadcast_tx
text: tibble one row containing: hash: transaction hash (character) status: execution outcome (list-column) transaction: original transaction object (list-column) receipts: array receipt outcomes (list-column) raw: full raw JSON response (list-column, useful debugging) wait_until = "NONE", hash returned.

title: Broadcast a Signed Transaction to the NEAR Network — near_broadcast_tx
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # 1. Real example using near-cli generated signed tx (testnet) signed_tx <- "aGVsbG8gd29ybGQ..."  # your actual base64 string from near-cli  near_set_endpoint("testnet")  # Quick fire-and-forget near_broadcast_tx(signed_tx, wait_until = "NONE") #> # A tibble: 1 × 1 #>   hash #>   <chr> #> 1 Cj3k...examplehash  # Wait for execution (recommended for most apps) result <- near_broadcast_tx(signed_tx, wait_until = "EXECUTED_OPTIMISTIC") result result$status[[1]]$SuccessValue  # view return value if function call  # Wait for finality (for critical operations) final <- near_broadcast_tx(signed_tx, wait_until = "FINAL") final$receipts } # }

what: Call a Read-Only View Function on a NEAR Smart Contract — near_call_view_function
title: Call a Read-Only View Function on a NEAR Smart Contract — near_call_view_function
text: Executes contract view method returns decoded text + parsed JSON. Works perfectly wrap.near, ref-finance, NEP-141 tokens.

title: Call a Read-Only View Function on a NEAR Smart Contract — near_call_view_function
code: near_call_view_function(   account_id,   method_name,   args = list(),   finality = "final",   block_id = NULL )

title: Call a Read-Only View Function on a NEAR Smart Contract — near_call_view_function
text: account_id Character. Contract account (e.g. "wrap.near"). method_name Character. Method call (e.g. "ft_metadata"). args Named list arguments. Use list() args. finality "final" (default) "optimistic". block_id Optional block height hash (overrides finality).

title: Call a Read-Only View Function on a NEAR Smart Contract — near_call_view_function
text: tibble : result_raw raw bytes result_text UTF-8 decoded string result_json parsed JSON (NULL JSON) logs, block_height, block_hash, raw_response metadata

title: Call a Read-Only View Function on a NEAR Smart Contract — near_call_view_function
code: near_set_endpoint("mainnet") #> ✔ NEAR RPC endpoint set to <https://rpc.mainnet.near.org>  # FT Metadata near_call_view_function("wrap.near", "ft_metadata") #> # A tibble: 1 × 9 #>   account_id method_name result_raw result_text result_json  logs   block_height #>   <chr>      <chr>       <list>     <chr>       <list>       <list>        <int> #> 1 wrap.near  ft_metadata <raw>      "{\"spec\"… <named list> <list>    176267995 #> # ℹ 2 more variables: block_hash <chr>, raw_response <list>  # Total supply near_call_view_function("wrap.near", "ft_total_supply") #> # A tibble: 1 × 9 #>   account_id method_name  result_raw result_text result_json logs   block_height #>   <chr>      <chr>        <list>     <chr>       <list>      <list>        <int> #> 1 wrap.near  ft_total_su… <raw [34]> "\"1823370… <chr [1]>   <list>    176267996 #> # ℹ 2 more variables: block_hash <chr>, raw_response <list>  # Balance query — REQUIRED argument! near_call_view_function(   "wrap.near",   "ft_balance_of",   args = list(account_id = "vitalik.near") ) #> # A tibble: 1 × 9 #>   account_id method_name  result_raw result_text result_json logs   block_height #>   <chr>      <chr>        <list>     <chr>       <list>      <list>        <int> #> 1 wrap.near  ft_balance_… <raw [3]>  "\"0\""     <chr [1]>   <list>    176267996 #> # ℹ 2 more variables: block_hash <chr>, raw_response <list>  # Ref Finance pool info near_call_view_function(   "v2.ref-finance.near",   "get_pool",   args = list(pool_id = 513) ) #> # A tibble: 1 × 9 #>   account_id method_name result_raw result_text result_json  logs   block_height #>   <chr>      <chr>       <list>     <chr>       <list>       <list>        <int> #> 1 v2.ref-fi… get_pool    <raw>      "{\"pool_k… <named list> <list>    176267996 #> # ℹ 2 more variables: block_hash <chr>, raw_response <list>

what: List Access Keys for a NEAR Account — near_get_access_keys
title: List Access Keys for a NEAR Account — near_get_access_keys
text: Retrieves access keys (full access + function call keys) associated NEAR account. Uses query RPC method request_type = "view_access_key_list".

title: List Access Keys for a NEAR Account — near_get_access_keys
code: near_get_access_keys(   account_id,   finality = c("final", "optimistic"),   block_id = NULL )

title: List Access Keys for a NEAR Account — near_get_access_keys
text: account_id Character scalar. account ID query (e.g., "alice.near", "bob.testnet"). finality Character. Block finality: "final" (default, safest) "optimistic" (faster). block_id Integer character. Optional specific block height hash. used together finality.

title: List Access Keys for a NEAR Account — near_get_access_keys
text: tibble one row per access key: public_key Ed25519 public key base58 format (e.g., "ed25519:8z...") access_key List-column containing permission details: nonce – current nonce permission – either "FullAccess" FunctionCall object allowance, receiver_id, method_names block_height, block_hash context query raw_response full RPC response debugging

title: List Access Keys for a NEAR Account — near_get_access_keys
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set endpoint first near_set_endpoint("mainnet") near_get_access_keys("vitalik.near") } # }

what: Get Block Information by Height, Hash, or
title: Get Block Information by Height, Hash, or
text: Retrieves block header chunk info. Works perfectly "final", numeric height, block hash.

title: Get Block Information by Height, Hash, or
code: near_get_block(block_id = "final")

title: Get Block Information by Height, Hash, or
text: block_id One : "final" — latest finalized block Integer — block height (e.g. 123456789) Character — full block hash

title: Get Block Information by Height, Hash, or
text: tibble block details including timestamp, author, gas price, etc.

title: Get Block Information by Height, Hash, or
code: near_set_endpoint("mainnet") #> ✔ NEAR RPC endpoint set to <https://rpc.mainnet.near.org>  # Latest finalized block near_get_block("final") #> Error in httr2::req_perform(.): HTTP 400 Bad Request.  # By height near_get_block(176259877) #> # A tibble: 1 × 8 #>      height hash     prev_hash timestamp           author chunks_count gas_price #>       <int> <chr>    <chr>     <dttm>              <chr>         <int> <chr>     #> 1 176259877 CanDKa6… BREsXR6t… 2025-12-10 17:47:44 epic.…            9 100000000 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: raw_response <list>  # By hash (example) near_get_block("CanDKa6nYDQ89iv5U7sE1YDFteBRkBG6qBJjiM5YwGtY") #> # A tibble: 1 × 8 #>      height hash     prev_hash timestamp           author chunks_count gas_price #>       <int> <chr>    <chr>     <dttm>              <chr>         <int> <chr>     #> 1 176259877 CanDKa6… BREsXR6t… 2025-12-10 17:47:44 epic.…            9 100000000 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: raw_response <list>

what: Retrieve Current or Historical NEAR Protocol Configuration — near_get_protocol_config
title: Retrieve Current or Historical NEAR Protocol Configuration — near_get_protocol_config
text: Queries experimental EXPERIMENTAL_protocol_config RPC method get full protocol configuration given block — including gas costs, fees, runtime limits, staking parameters, . Extremely useful analytics, tooling, understanding protocol upgrades time.

title: Retrieve Current or Historical NEAR Protocol Configuration — near_get_protocol_config
code: near_get_protocol_config(finality = c("final", "optimistic"), block_id = NULL)

title: Retrieve Current or Historical NEAR Protocol Configuration — near_get_protocol_config
text: finality Character. Block finality: "final" (default & safest) "optimistic" (faster). block_id Integer character. Optional specific block height hash. Use historical queries. used together finality.

title: Retrieve Current or Historical NEAR Protocol Configuration — near_get_protocol_config
text: tibble one row containing: block_height Height config fetched block_hash Hash block config Full protocol config named list (deeply nested) runtime_config Runtime-specific settings (storage costs, WASM limits, etc.) raw_response Complete RPC response debugging

title: Retrieve Current or Historical NEAR Protocol Configuration — near_get_protocol_config
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Current (latest final) protocol config cfg <- near_get_protocol_config() cfg  # Extract storage cost per byte cfg$runtime_config$storage_amount_per_byte  # Compare gas prices across time old <- near_get_protocol_config(block_id = 60000000) new <- near_get_protocol_config(block_id = 120000000)  list(   old_gas_price = old$config$min_gas_price,   new_gas_price = new$config$min_gas_price )  # How much does it cost to store 1 KB today? cost_yocto <- 1e3 * cfg$runtime_config$storage_config$storage_amount_per_byte cost_near  <- cost_yocto / 1e24 cat("Cost to store 1 KB:", cost_near, "NEAR")  # View all fee schedules cfg$config$fees } # }

what: Check Transaction Status and Outcome — near_get_transaction_status
title: Check Transaction Status and Outcome — near_get_transaction_status
text: Check Transaction Status Outcome

title: Check Transaction Status and Outcome — near_get_transaction_status
code: near_get_transaction_status(   tx_hash,   sender_account_id,   wait_until = "EXECUTED_OPTIMISTIC" )

title: Check Transaction Status and Outcome — near_get_transaction_status
text: tx_hash Transaction hash (base58). sender_account_id Account sent transaction. wait_until Wait level (defaults "EXECUTED_OPTIMISTIC").

title: Check Transaction Status and Outcome — near_get_transaction_status
text: Detailed outcome tibble.

title: Check Transaction Status and Outcome — near_get_transaction_status
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ near_get_transaction_status("B3ho6i6nDbJm95PpXuhbZXhGwZzJkhMkwf8qpbu35AMr", "meteor-relayer.near") } # }

what: Get Current or Historical Epoch Validators with Real Stakes — near_get_validators
title: Get Current or Historical Epoch Validators with Real Stakes — near_get_validators
text: Fetches validator set current epoch (specific epoch) using official validators RPC method. reliable public endpoint returns actual stake amounts (yoctoNEAR).

title: Get Current or Historical Epoch Validators with Real Stakes — near_get_validators
code: near_get_validators(epoch_id = NULL)

title: Get Current or Historical Epoch Validators with Real Stakes — near_get_validators
text: epoch_id NULL (default) current epoch, specific epoch hash/ID.

title: Get Current or Historical Epoch Validators with Real Stakes — near_get_validators
text: tibble one row per validator: account_id Validator account public_key Ed25519 public key stake_yocto Stake big integer string stake_near Stake whole NEAR (rounded 2 decimals) is_slashed Logical: validator slashed? shards Integer vector assigned shards blocks_produced / blocks_expected Block production stats chunks_produced / chunks_expected Chunk production stats uptime_pct Overall uptime % (blocks + chunks) epoch_height Epoch height raw_response Full RPC result (debugging)

title: Get Current or Historical Epoch Validators with Real Stakes — near_get_validators
code: # Current epoch validators vals <- near_get_validators() vals |> slice_head(n = 10) #> Error in slice_head(vals, n = 10): could not find function "slice_head"  # Top 5 by stake vals |> arrange(desc(stake_near)) |> slice_head(n = 5) #> Error in slice_head(arrange(vals, desc(stake_near)), n = 5): could not find function "slice_head"  # Find any slashed validators vals |> filter(is_slashed) #> Error in data.matrix(data): 'list' object cannot be coerced to type 'double'  # Plot stake distribution library(ggplot2) vals |>   slice_max(stake_near, n = 20) |>   ggplot(aes(reorder(account_id, stake_near), stake_near, fill = is_slashed)) +   geom_col() +   coord_flip() +   labs(title = "Top 20 NEAR Validators by Stake", x = "Validator", y = "Stake (NEAR)") +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("FALSE" = "#00F6D2", "TRUE" = "#FF4444")) #> Error in slice_max(vals, stake_near, n = 20): could not find function "slice_max"  # Total staked NEAR sum(vals$stake_near) #> [1] 581868204

title: Query Account Details and Balance — near_query_account

what: Perform a Raw JSON-RPC Call to a NEAR Node — near_rpc
title: Perform a Raw JSON-RPC Call to a NEAR Node — near_rpc
text: Internal function powers every exported API call. Sends properly formatted JSON-RPC 2.0 request handles errors gracefully.

title: Perform a Raw JSON-RPC Call to a NEAR Node — near_rpc
code: near_rpc(   method,   params = list(),   timeout = getOption("nearjsonrpc.timeout", 30) )

title: Perform a Raw JSON-RPC Call to a NEAR Node — near_rpc
text: method Character scalar. RPC method name (e.g., "query", "block", "status"). params Named list parameters (can empty). timeout Maximum seconds wait response (default: 30).

title: Perform a Raw JSON-RPC Call to a NEAR Node — near_rpc
text: parsed R object (usually list) JSON response.

title: Perform a Raw JSON-RPC Call to a NEAR Node — near_rpc
text: HTTP errors → rlang::abort() status code JSON-RPC errors → informative message node Network timeouts → clear error

what: Set or Retrieve the Active NEAR RPC Endpoint — near_set_endpoint
title: Set or Retrieve the Active NEAR RPC Endpoint — near_set_endpoint
text: Configures JSON-RPC endpoint used nearjsonrpc functions. Supports: Shortcuts: "mainnet", "testnet", "betanet" custom URL (archival nodes, Pagoda, QuickNode, Lava, etc.) argument → prints returns current endpoint endpoint stored options("nearjsonrpc.endpoint") defaults testnet.

title: Set or Retrieve the Active NEAR RPC Endpoint — near_set_endpoint
code: near_set_endpoint(endpoint = NULL)

title: Set or Retrieve the Active NEAR RPC Endpoint — near_set_endpoint
text: endpoint Character scalar. Use: "mainnet" → https://rpc.mainnet.near.org "testnet" → https://rpc.testnet.near.org (default) "betanet" → https://rpc.betanet.near.org full URL like "https://archival-rpc.mainnet.near.org" NULL (omitted), returns current endpoint.

title: Set or Retrieve the Active NEAR RPC Endpoint — near_set_endpoint
text: Invisibly returns active endpoint. Useful piping.

title: Set or Retrieve the Active NEAR RPC Endpoint — near_set_endpoint
code: # 1. Use shortcuts near_set_endpoint("mainnet") #> ✔ NEAR RPC endpoint set to <https://rpc.mainnet.near.org> near_set_endpoint("testnet")     # default #> ✔ NEAR RPC endpoint set to <https://rpc.testnet.near.org> near_set_endpoint("betanet") #> ✔ NEAR RPC endpoint set to <https://rpc.betanet.near.org>  # 2. Custom / archival / third-party nodes near_set_endpoint("https://archival-rpc.mainnet.near.org") #> ✔ NEAR RPC endpoint set to <https://archival-rpc.mainnet.near.org> near_set_endpoint("https://rpc.mainnet.pagoda.co") #> ✔ NEAR RPC endpoint set to <https://rpc.mainnet.pagoda.co> near_set_endpoint("https://near.lava.build")  # Lava Network #> ✔ NEAR RPC endpoint set to <https://near.lava.build>  # 3. Just view current endpoint (no change) near_set_endpoint() #> ℹ Current NEAR endpoint: <https://near.lava.build> getOption("nearjsonrpc.endpoint") #> [1] "https://near.lava.build"  # 4. Chain with other functions near_set_endpoint("mainnet") |>   near_query_account("near.near") #> ✔ NEAR RPC endpoint set to <https://rpc.mainnet.near.org> #> Error in httr2::req_perform(.): HTTP 400 Bad Request.  # 5. Use in scripts with error handling tryCatch({   near_set_endpoint("invalid-url") }, error = function(e) message("Bad URL! ", e$message)) #> Bad URL! Invalid endpoint — must start with http:// or https:// #>   You provided: {.val {endpoint}}

what: Manage NEAR RPC Endpoint and Perform JSON-RPC Calls — utils
title: Manage NEAR RPC Endpoint and Perform JSON-RPC Calls — utils
text: functions form backbone nearjsonrpc: near_set_endpoint() lets users switch mainnet, testnet, custom nodes. near_rpc() internal low-level JSON-RPC engine used exported functions. %||% lightweight null-coalescing operator (dependency-free).
